SigridDialogue1: ^[You prepare to knock on the lighthouse entrance...]
^[...but someone opens the door before your fist can reach it.]
^Don't look so alarmed, I saw you approaching from the top of the lighthouse.
^I don't recognize you at all. You new here?

g-0: ^I'm Cleo. I'm... sort of just passing by, really.
^Good to meet you, Cleo. I'm Sigrid!
^So what brings you here? It's not often I get guests.
g-1: ^I need to collect some Y, if that's okay?
^I gotta admit, I'm a little hesitant to give off resources like that to a total stranger.
^Nothing personal, of course! I don't mean to seem cold. Just not used to outsiders is all.
g-2: ^I was actually sent here by Bengt. He told me to give you this letter.
^Oh, I see! It's for one of his projects, then?
^Alright. A friend of Bengt's is a friend of mine. I'll let you have some Y.
^And don't worry about paying me back for this. I'll make it Bengt's problem for sending you out here.
^You good to go? Or is there anything else I can help you with?
g-3: ^I'm trying to find out what happened to my parents. I heard they passed by here.
^I haven't heard of anyone else passing by lately, are you sure you're at the right place?
g-4: ^I received this letter from someone here.
^[She glances at your boat in the harbor.]
^I thought I recognized that old thing.
^Sorry to say, I have no clue where your parents went.
^I'm sure Bengt already told you, but we found that boat a very long time ago.
^Even if we did know something, we might not remember very well.
g-5: ^Well, err... anyway, don't keep Bengt waiting.
^Knowing him, he's probably itching to get his hands busy with that old boat. It's been taunting him for years.
